other_tests.findings: Active extension lag of 20° to 35°; passive range of motion varied; hypoplasia of femoral condyles noted; proximally positioned patella (patella alta)
other_tests.changes_over_time: Active extension lag increased to 40°; no specific changes in passive range of motion but showed further hypoplasia and atrophy of quadriceps muscle

other_tests.findings: Patella positioned in the patellofemoral groove; reconstructed patellar tendon intact
other_tests.changes_over_time: Two years postoperatively, demonstrated that the patella and reconstructed patellar tendon were in physiologic position, but quadriceps muscle remained atrophic

other_tests.findings: Patellar tendon aplasia documented on physical examination and ultrasonographic testing; patella in a more proximal position than normal
Patella of normal size, positioned proximal to the patellofemoral groove; patellar tendon absent; quadriceps muscle severely hypotrophic
other_tests.changes_over_time: No changes were noted over the two-year follow-up period
